bug.author: sameerkumar16
bug.description:
I download models like this python -m spacy download en python -m spacy download en_core_web_md Above commands create a link like this Linking successful /home/sameer/anaconda2/envs/py34/lib/python3.4/site-packages/en_core_web_md --> /home/sameer/anaconda2/envs/py34/lib/python3.4/site-packages/spacy/data/en_core_web_md <denchmark-code>You can now load the model via spacy.load('en_core_web_md') </denchmark-code>
But when I actually load the model ,it throws the following error
import spacy nlp= spacy.load('en_core_web_md') Traceback (most recent call last): File "/home/sameer/anaconda2/envs/py34/lib/python3.4/site-packages/spacy/util.py", line 126, in load_model_from_link cls = import_file(name, path) File "/home/sameer/anaconda2/envs/py34/lib/python3.4/site-packages/spacy/compat.py", line 118, in import_file module = importlib.util.module_from_spec(spec) AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'module_from_spec' During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred: Traceback (most recent call last): File "", line 1, in File "/home/sameer/anaconda2/envs/py34/lib/python3.4/site-packages/spacy/init.py", line 19, in load return util.load_model(name, **overrides) File "/home/sameer/anaconda2/envs/py34/lib/python3.4/site-packages/spacy/util.py", line 112, in load_model return load_model_from_link(name, **overrides) File "/home/sameer/anaconda2/envs/py34/lib/python3.4/site-packages/spacy/util.py", line 130, in load_model_from_link "points to a valid package (not just a data directory)." % name) OSError: Cant' load 'en_core_web_md'. If you're using a shortcut link, make sure it points to a valid package (not just a data directory).
<denchmark-h:h2>Your Environment</denchmark-h>
* **Python version:** 3.4.5
Platform: Linux-4.4.0-101-generic-x86_64-with-debian-jessie-sid
Models: cache, en_core_web_md, en, en-1.1.0
spaCy version: 2.0.5
Operating System: Ububtu 14.04
Python Version Used: 3.4.5
spaCy Version Used: 2.0.5
Environment Information: Conda Virtual Environment

comments.comment:
Thanks for the report!
AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'module_from_spec'
It looks like the linking itself worked fine â€“ but the problem here is that <denchmark-link:https://docs.python.org/3/library/importlib.html#importlib.util.module_from_spec>importlib's module_from_spec</denchmark-link> , which spaCy uses to load model packages from paths, only exists in Python 3.5, not 3.4. We do have a <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/blob/master/spacy/compat.py#L53>workaround for this in the spacy.compat</denchmark-link> module, but this seems to only target Python 2 vs. Python 3. (I guess since 3.4 is less commonly used, this hasn't come up before). If you don't want to dig into the source and don't want to / can't upgrade to Python 3.5, the easiest workaround for now would be to simply <denchmark-link:https://spacy.io/usage/models#usage-import>import the model as a module</denchmark-link> and call its method. Since the model is installed as a package, this works just as well: import en_core_web_md nlp = en_core_web_md.load()
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
